result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit, if any. Remainder to be paid from up to 25% of the defendant's prison funds. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample.

Consecutive to: the defendant's current sentence
**09-26-16 defendant granted four days of sentence credit.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrus Isaac Washington

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant requesting to serve sentence in the House of Correction.
Per order dated/signed 09-26-16 defendant granted four days credit.

Received, signed and filed:
Decision and order partially granting request for sentence credit.
Copy forwarded to the defendant.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. mag
Letter to defendant.
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.

Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz.  Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
As to count 2:
On state's motion, Court ordered the penalty enhancer, DV repeater, stricken.  In addition, the court amended count 2 to "Child Abuse Recklessly Cause Harm, pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b), a ClassI felony.
As to count 2 as amended:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
As to counts 1, 3 and 4:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, counts 1, 3 and 4 are dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing continued...
.
As to count 2:
  Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement by: 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 10 months at the House of Correction, consecutive to the defendant's current sentence,  with -0- days credit.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges from bail on deposit, if any, remainder to be paid from up to 25% of the defendant's prison funds.  Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.
Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; defendant is to provide a DNA sample.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Andrew Michael Meetz in court, defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington not in court, in custody.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defense counsel is requesting that the court grant his request for a brief adjournment for plea and sentencing in Branch 36.
Court grants the request.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in court with attorney Andrew Michael Meetz. Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant is currently in custody serving a sentence.  The court ordered that the bail is set at $4000.00.  If the defendant's custodial situation changes, the defense may bring case is in for a bail review.
Case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Public defender's office is requesting additional time to have an attorney appear in court and the defendant has another case scheduled for 04/13/16.  Case rescheduled for 04/13/16 at 08:30 a.m. for return on a warrant.
cab

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 04/05/2016.  Bench Warrant in file.  Case scheduled for Return on Bench Warrant on 04/11/2016 at 08:30 a.m. in Branch 36.  Parties notified.
cab
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($2000.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court.  Kristin M. Schrank and Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for jury trial. State ready to proceed. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. State's witness is unavailable for reasons placed on the record. State requested an adjournment, defense objected. Court GRANTED state's request. Case is adjourned for Jury Trial. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State' s Amended Witness List, File by Assistant District Attorney Kristin M. Schrank

Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requesting Jury Trial be adjourned due to scheduling conflict. Court GRANTED adjournment of Jury Trial. Court VACATED Jury Trial date of 02/09/2015. Case adjourned to branch 23 for trial.  Jury trial scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Motion to Adjourn Trial. Parties in court, matter set to address motion on 1/29/2015 in branch 23 at 8:30 AM.

Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington NOT in court, in custody with attorney Matt Ricci. Kristin Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2nd Call, parties ready to proceed. No spin courts available. Case will be adjourned to branch 23, case passed to allow defendant to appear in court. 
CASE RECALLED
Defendant Tyrus Washington now in court, all other appearances remain the same. Case adjourned for Jury Trail to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. 1st call call, parties passed to address court calendar.

Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Status Conference with pending matters set for Sentencing. Case remains set for Jury Trial in branch 23. Case adjourned to 10/06/2014 at 8:30 am.
Discussion as to bail. Defendant's Speedy Trial Demand time limits expiring, court ordered signature bond.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington not in court, in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank for Abbey DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Jury Trial. State's witness unavailable, requests adjournment, defense requests dismissal. For reasons placed on the record, the court GRANTED state's request for adjournment. Case adjourned to branch 23 for status conference with pending matters and jury trial.  Status conference scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matt Ricci in court, defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington not in court, in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case heard off the record. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record. State's offer is withdrawn as of today's date. Defense advised of possible alternate theory. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 07/21/2014.
Received & Filed, State's Motion In Limine, State's Reqeusted Jury Instructions, and State's Witness List.

Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in custody.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone. Case Administratively transfered by Judge Flanagan to Branch 23 due to pending Domestic Violence cases in branch 23. Case called in branch 23 with pending matters. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Court VACATED pretrial conference in branch 4. Case set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial in branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in court with attorney Matt Ricci.  Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in custody.  Kristin M Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Eric Sweeney.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  All available discovery, including an offer letter was turned over to defense counsel by the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 5-20-2014 at 1:30 pm.   Defendant has other cases assigned to Branch 23; (2012CF3490 and 12CM5798), that have a different victim then case 2014CF1560.  The Court defers on placement of cases.  mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dawanda P, BP (5/15/98), all residents of 2248 N. 41st Street in Milwaukee County. 
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Tyrus Isaac Washington in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
